
### restricted characters in pointers?  {.smaller}


* recall: put pointer to buffer in stack pointer
* example buffer pointer: <code>0x7fffffffde2c</code>
* as bytes (little endian, loweset address first): <br> <code>2C DE FF FF FF 7F 00 00</code> 
<hr class="vspace" />
* what if <code>00</code> bytes aren't allowed in input? 

   * no problem: prior value of return address probably has 0s already

* what if <code>2C</code> or <code>DE</code> not allowed in input? 

   * can probably find other location on stack writen by overflow
   * NB: could place code after overwritten return address

* [what if <code>7F</code> or <code>FF</code> not allowed in input?]{.fragment fragment-index=2 .custom .myem-only}
